questions.text: How long ago did Josh give Donna a key to his apartment?
questions.explanation:
Six years.

	While they were at the White House reception after Leo's funeral, Josh was wondering if Donna still had the key to his apartment so she could come over that night.

questions.text: Who was not a pall bearer at Leo's funeral?
questions.explanation:
Toby.

	The pall bearers for Leo's funeral were Josh, President Bartlet, Barry Goodwin, Charlie, Santos, and one unidentified man. Toby sat with Andie at the funeral and later walked out of the church with Charlie.

questions.text: What did the three Congressmen that Santos met with have in common when they spoke about Leo's funeral?
questions.correct: It was more of a celebration.
options: Leo would love to be Vice President.
Leo was like a brother to me.
questions.explanation:
It was more of a celebration.

	Santos had moved his people into the OEOB for the transition to the White House. While he stayed in the transition office, Santos worked on finding a Speaker of the House. He met with three men, one of which was a good friend from Texas named Fields who wanted Santos to back him for Speaker of the House. The other two Congressmen were Sellner and Marino, but Josh said even Marino's wife wouldn't vote for him.

questions.text: Why did Donna ask to stay with CJ?
options: She didn't want Josh to know where she was.
She was apartment hunting and still hadn't found one.
questions.explanation:
She sublet her apartment.

	Since the campaign was over and everyone from the campaign was officially back in Washington, Donna didn't have a place to stay because she sublet her apartment while she was on the campaign trail. CJ told Donna she could stay with her if she could find the bed in her spare bedroom.

questions.text: After Leo's funeral, did Santos offer Amy Gardener a job?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Amy showed up at the funeral for Leo and afterward she met with Josh to talk about the female candidate for Vice President and to set Josh up with a woman she knows. Later, Santos offered Amy the Head of Legislative Affairs so she could fix the system from inside the White House.

questions.text: When CJ met with Ainsley, how long did Ainsley say she had been working at the Hoover Institute
questions.explanation:
9 days.

	After Ainsley revealed she had been working at the Hoover Institute for nine days, she asked CJ to help her get a job in the Santos White House. CJ asked Josh to consider Ainsley for a job as White House Counsel.

questions.text: While in the residence telling stories about Leo, CJ said Leo was in the 1962 Olympics. Was Leo telling the truth?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Annabeth thought Leo was telling the truth about being in the 1962 Olympics until Will told her that there were no Olympics held in 1962.

questions.text: While in CJ's office, who did Danny say had his fly open during Leo's funeral service?
questions.explanation:
Majority leader.

	Danny showed up three hours early for the reception so he could talk to CJ. One of the things Danny mentioned while they talked was that he noticed the Majority leader had his fly open throughout Leo's funeral, but didn't tell him because Danny didn't like the guy.

questions.text: What job did Charlie say Josh should give Donna in the Santos White House?
questions.correct: Nothing short of Secretary of Commerce
questions.explanation:
Nothing short of Secretary of Commerce.

	Donna came in to Charlie office which was Will and Annabeth's old office to see how he liked having his own office. Charlie asked her if Josh had given her a job yet in the White House and said that she should have nothing short of Secretary of Commerce.

questions.text: President-Elect Santos went with Josh's recommendation and didn't recommend his best friend as Speaker of the House.
questions.explanation:
True.

	While most of the old West Wing staffers were telling stories about Leo in the residence, President-Elect Santos was informing his good friend that he wasn't going to ask him to be Speaker of the House because of how it would look.
